Name: LaserZone
About the game: Puzzles LaserZone is a Sci-Fi, top-down puzzle game. In this game, you will be playing as ‘Handel’; the protagonist who finds himself trapped inside lethal puzzles, and aims to escape by using his brainpower. LaserZone uses easy-to-understand science concepts as puzzle mechanics. For example, Rotate Prisms to reflect Lasers. Exploit velocity and force from Moving Walks and Gravity Turrets to move objects. Use Switches and EMP Gun to power up and down traps. What you might have come across during science class in school, now returns as puzzles in a concise fashion. This is the key feature of the LaserZone. Actions Sometimes, in LaserZone, reflexes are crucial for your escape. Bullets force-open Item Boxes for you, but sometimes can form a dangerous barrage in certain maps. Gravity Towers that push or pull objects may drive you into a Minefield. If you somehow survived, then robots will appear to take you down. LaserZone is indeed about solving puzzles. But sometimes, you’ll need to fight and evade. Tools and Upgrades As you continue the game, the difficulty will generally increase. However, you will be given Tools and Upgrades to overcome any difficulties. You may acquire a few equipment with luck, but most upgrades will cost Resources which must be earned with effort. Plot, Story & Directing Handel wakes up inside his crash-landed spaceship, suffering a loss of memory. He searches nearby places to recover from amnesia and find usable parts for the spaceship. Shortly, he sets his foot in an enormous facility, unknowing the existence of deadly traps lurking inside. Will he be able to recover his memory, and reclaim the treasure greater than his own life? Several characters including Handel will appear in LaserZone. Handel talks with them, sometimes confront them, reminds himself of what happened in the past, and moves forward to end the journey once and for all. Art LaserZone is a 2D game with a three-dimensional effect. It is built based on Cycles Render from Blender Cycles 3D Tool. Thanks to Cycles Render's power, we have created a world brimming with futuristic artworks and Sci-Fi atmosphere. * LaserZone uses free classic music as BGM, whose copyrights AND neighboring copyrights have expired.
